Lets-Learn-About-Turtles.pdf.footnote: (Connecticut Department of Energy and Environmental Protection, n.d.)

Case_Study_U.S._Freshwater_Turtles_and_T.reference: Luiselli, L., Starita, A., Carpaneto, G. M., Segniagbeto, G. H., & Amori, G. (2016). A short review of the international trade of wild tortoises and freshwater turtles across the world and throughout two decades. *Chelonian Conservation and Biology*, *15*(2), 167–172. https://doi.org/10.2744/CCB-1216.1
Case_Study_U.S._Freshwater_Turtles_and_T.footnote: Luiselli et al. (2016) analyzed CITES data from 1990–2010 and found that approximately 2 million wild individual freshwater turtles and tortoises were traded globally, with Malaysia, the United States, and Indonesia each responsible for over 20% of exports.
